pageContext.claim: “And the problem with Puerto Rico is their electric grid and their electric generating plant was dead before the storms ever hit. It was in very bad shape. It was in bankruptcy. It had no money. It was largely -- you know, it was largely closed.”
pageContext.analysis: Puerto Rico's electric utility had filed for a form of bankruptcy before the hurricanes in 2017. Its service was spotty but the power company was not "largely closed" or "dead." Power was knocked out by the storms.
